newsitem.title: GERMANY: Schering - Betaferon 9-month sales up 36 pct.
newsitem.headline: Schering - Betaferon 9-month sales up 36 pct.

text.p: German drugs group Schering AG said on Monday sales of its multiple sclerosis drug Betaferon increased 36 percent in the first nine-months to 395 million marks.
"In Europe Betaferon sales largely met our expectations, with the exception of sales in Great Britain," Schering said in its nine-month report.

In the U.S., the group said sales of the product were at year-ago levels, even though the company was feeling the consequences of a competing product, which was launched in the second quarter of the year.
Schering had earlier in the year predicted that its 1996 global sales of Betaferon will be about 530 million marks.

In the Spring, U.S. group Biogen received approval for its Avonex drug and Israeli group Teva in September received preliminary approval from the F.D.A. for its Copaxone product, both competing multiple sclerosis drugs.
